body_html: I fear this is going to get brittle, especially if you are shipping CUDA libs. e.g. a user swaps HW and picks up a new driver and/or toolkit. As @soumith says, I'm pretty sure you want to use the runtime paths. Similarly, CUDA 7.5 won't run on Pascal and we have a cudnn built for 7.5 that will not do the right thing on CUDA 8, so those need to go together. If a user installs the CUDA bits via deb/rpm the right things are supposed to happen. If you push bits, we need to figure out how to make sure things line up. But this is perhaps a much larger packaging conversation.
